title: How to write my first sales letter - Quora

response.answer_text: Narrow down your audience by age, location, and more. Write to them as if they were you buddies by not being too formal and polite - you can even have ‘intentional’ grammar mistakes. Most importantly, keep talking about them - not you, and empathize with them by truly understanding their problem(s). Of course, keep it short, to the point, and mainly interesting. Open questions are always a huge plus…
The first thing you need to do is understand your prospects. The next thing you need to do is find a good sales letter format.

What do you mean by “choose a subject to sell”? Do you need help choosing a product or a service to sell? Is that what you mean? You are asking someone to teach you how to write a sales letter and there are tons of books and ebooks, and information online. I think you should just be blunt and ask someone to write it for you. From what it sounds like, you don’t want to learn copywriting, otherwise why would you post such a broad and unnecessary question that can be answered by you researching and choosing a “subject” on your own and actually attempting to learn.

You determine what message you are trying to convey? I’m assuming you have a targeted market or individual you are writing to? So explain how you can be a solution to their problem. Whether you are in a product or service industry, the real sales come when you are solving a problem. Use your letter to solve a problem.
